Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
Sprite
<operating system> An {operating system} from {Berkeley} supporting {multiprocessing} and distributed files.
[Details? References?]
(1994-10-17)

Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
sprite
<graphics, file format> A small {bitmap} image, often used in animated games but also sometimes used as a synonym for {icon}.
(1997-06-29)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Sprite \Sprite\ (spr[imac]t), n. [OE. sprit, F. esprit, fr. L. spiritus. See {Spirit}, and cf. {Sprightly}.] 1. A spirit; a soul; a shade; also, an apparition. See {Spright}. [1913 Webster]
Gaping graves received the wandering, guilty sprite. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]
2. An elf; a fairy; a goblin. [1913 Webster]
3. (Zo["o]l.) The green woodpecker, or yaffle. [1913 Webster]
sprite n : small, human in form, playful, having magical powers [syn: {fairy}, {faery}, {faerie}]
